missions.title: Missions
missions.noSelectedDescription: Choose a mission from the list.

winObjective.countBelow: Less than {count} out of {subjects} can survive.

messages.tutorial0:
Welcome to the target practice tutorial!
Use the mouse to aim and left click to fire at the target container in front of you.
messages.tutorial0b: Destroy the target container. Hold the left mouse button for continuous fire. Keep hitting it until it explodes.
messages.tutorial1: An arrow marks the targets which are not visible in front of you.
messages.tutorial2: Use T to cycle through hostile targets.

messages.caution: Nice work taking out the bombers! Now stay clear of the Mississippi and let the frigates do their job.

messages.test:
This is a test mission. Fly around and do as you please.
This reminder will be displayed 5 times.
messages.test2: You can freely destroy other spacecrafts.

battle.developmentVersionNotice: Interstellar Armada: Galactic Ace - development version: {version}

message.ready:
Ready!
During the game, press the {menuKey} key to open the menu, where you can also check and adjust the controls.
message.victory:
Victory!
Congratulations, you have completed all mission objectives!
Press {jumpKey} key to leave the battlefield and conclude the mission.
message.defeat:
Defeat!
You ship has been destroyed. You can keep looking around in spectator mode or press the {menuKey} key to open the menu.
message.fail:
Defeat!
You have failed the mission objectives.
You can keep flying around or press the {menuKey} key to open the menu.

description.victory: You have earned {performance} medal for your performance in this mission.
description.nextPerformance: Achieve a performance score of {score} or more to earn a higher level distinction.
description.fail: You did not manage to complete all the objectives for this mission.
description.defeat: Your spacecraft has been destroyed during the mission.
description.leftEarly: You left the battlefield before completing all the mission objectives.

about.title: About
about.aboutGameParagraph: This game is a learning project in the early development phase. The current version is only intended for testing the initial, already implemented features of what one day might become a functional game. Even the core features are yet under development. The game might contain numerous bugs.
about.aboutAuthorLicenseParagraph:
This project is developed by Kriszti√°n Nagy, a BSc computer engineering graduate from Budapest University of Technology and Economics. The project is released under {license}, you can obtain the source code and the license from the project's {github} page.
The application features the {sansation} font family created by Bernd Montag, which is freeware, as well as the {aldrich} and {audiowide} fonts from the Google Fonts library, which are published under the {openFontLicense}.
The application uses the {requireJS} library for module management, which is available under {requireJSLicense}.
Some sound effects in the game were created using freely available sound samples, the sources of which can be found {soundSources}.
about.theNewBSDOrMITLicenses: the new BSD or MIT licenses
about.aboutUsedSoftwareParagraph: This game is created using freely available and/or open source software and open standards. For creating the in-game assets, {inkscape}, {blender}, {gimp}, {audacity}, {bfxr}, {lmms} and specialized tools developed (in {netbeans} and {lazarus}) by the author of the game are used, and the game itself is being developed using {netbeans}, {chrome} and {firefox}, all of these running on {ubuntu}.

actionDescriptions.stopTime: Stop the time in the game, with controls still available
actionDescriptions.toggleDevInfoVisibility: Toggle the visibility of version information and framerate
actionDescriptions.nextNonHostileTarget: Target next non-hostile (friendly or neutral) spacecraft
actionDescriptions.forward: Forward thrust (free mode) or increase speed
actionDescriptions.reverse: Reverse thrust (free mode) or decrease speed
actionDescriptions.jumpOut: Engage jump engines and leave the battlefield
actionDescriptions.controlCamera: Hold this button to control the camera instead of your spacecraft if you have the same controls assigned
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveLeft: Move the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveRight: Move the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveUp: Move the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveDown: Move the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveForward: Move the camera forward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraMoveBackward: Move the camera backward (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnLeft: Turn the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnRight: Turn the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnUp: Turn the camera upwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraTurnDown: Turn the camera downwards (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollLeft: Roll the camera to the left (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraRollRight: Roll the camera to the right (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraDecreaseFOV: Zoom in (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.cameraIncreaseFOV: Zoom out (if possible for the current view)
actionDescriptions.nextView: Change to the next view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.previousView: Change to the previous view of the currently followed spacecraft or the scene
actionDescriptions.resetView: Reset the current view to its original state
